member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.SortDirection.Default
member.summary: A default value for sort direction, this value should not be used; instead use Descending or Ascending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.SortDirection.Descending
member.summary: The items are sorted in descending order. Whether the sort is alphabetical, numerical, and so on, is determined by the data type of the column indicated in propkey.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.SortDirection.Ascending
member.summary: The items are sorted in ascending order. Whether the sort is alphabetical, numerical, and so on, is determined by the data type of the column indicated in propkey.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetOption and IQueryParser::GetOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Schema
member.summary: The value should be VT_LPWSTR and the path to a file containing a schema binary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Locale
member.summary: The value must be VT_EMPTY (the default) or a VT_UI4 that is an LCID. It is used as the locale of contents (not keywords) in the query to be searched for, when no other information is available. The default value is the current keyboard locale. Retrieving the value always returns a VT_UI4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.WordBreaker
member.summary: This option is used to override the default word breaker used when identifying keywords in queries. The default word breaker is chosen according to the language of the keywords (cf. SQSO_LANGUAGE_KEYWORDS below). When setting this option, the value should be VT_EMPTY for using the default word breaker, or a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting the IWordBreaker interface.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.NaturalSyntax
member.summary: The value should be VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to allow natural query syntax (the default) or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to allow only advanced query syntax. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL. This option is now deprecated, use SQSO_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.AutomaticWildcard
member.summary: The value should be VT_BOOL with VARIANT_TRUE to generate query expressions as if each word in the query had a star appended to it (unless followed by punctuation other than a parenthesis), or VT_EMPTY or VT_BOOL with VARIANT_FALSE to use the words as they are (the default). A word-wheeling application will generally want to set this option to true. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_BOOL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TraceLevel
member.summary: Reserved. The value should be VT_EMPTY (the default) or VT_I4. Retrieving the option always returns a VT_I4.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.LanguageKeywords
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a LANGID. It defaults to the default user UI language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.Syntax
member.summary: The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a STRUCTURED_QUERY_SYNTAX value. It defaults to SQS_NATURAL_QUERY_SYNTAX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.TimeZone
member.summary: The value must be a VT_BLOB that is a copy of a TIME_ZONE_INFORMATION structure. It defaults to the current time zone.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ImplicitConnector
member.summary: This setting decides what connector should be assumed between conditions when none is specified. The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CONDITION_TYPE. Only CT_AND_CONDITION and CT_OR_CONDITION are valid. It defaults to CT_AND_CONDITION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQuerySingleOption.ConnectorCase
member.summary: This setting decides whether there are special requirements on the case of connector keywords (such as AND or OR). The value must be a VT_UI4 that is a CASE_REQUIREMENT value. It defaults to CASE_REQUIREMENT_UPPER_IF_AQS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption
member.summary: Provides a set of flags to be used with IQueryParser::SetMultiOption to indicate individual options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.VirtualProperty
member.summary: The key should be property name P. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with an IEnumVARIANT which has two values: a VT_BSTR that is another property name Q and a VT_I4 that is a CONDITION_OPERATION cop. A predicate with property name P, some operation and a value V will then be replaced by a predicate with property name Q, operation cop and value V before further processing happens.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.DefaultProperty
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_LPWSTR with a property name P. A predicate with no property name and a value of type V (or any subtype of V) will then use property P.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.GeneratorForType
member.summary: The key should be a value type name V. The value should be a VT_UNKNOWN with a IConditionGenerator G. The GenerateForLeaf method of G will then be applied to any predicate with value type V and if it returns a query expression, that will be used. If it returns NULL, normal processing will be used instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StructuredQueryMultipleOption.MapProperty
member.summary: The key should be a property name P. The value should be a VT_VECTOR|VT_LPWSTR, where each string is a property name. The count must be at least one. This "map" will be added to those of the loaded schema and used during resolution. A second call with the same key will replace the current map. If the value is VT_NULL, the map will be removed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption
member.summary: Used by IQueryParserManager::SetOption to set parsing options. This can be used to specify schemas and localization options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.SchemaBinaryName
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the name of the file that contains the schema binary. The default value is StructuredQuerySchema.bin for the SystemIndex catalog and StructuredQuerySchemaTrivial.bin for the trivial catalog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.PreLocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: Either a VT_BOOL or a VT_LPWSTR. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is FALSE, a pre-localized schema will not be used. If the value is a VT_BOOL and is TRUE, IQueryParserManager will use the pre-localized schema binary in "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%\Microsoft\Windows". If the value is a VT_LPWSTR, the value should contain the full path of the folder in which the pre-localized schema binary can be found. The default value is VT_BOOL with TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.UnlocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the unlocalized schema binary. The default value is "%SYSTEMROOT%\System32".

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizedSchemaBinaryPath
member.summary: A VT_LPWSTR containing the full path to the folder that contains the localized schema binary that can be read and written to as needed. The default value is "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows".

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.AppendLCIDToLocalizedPath
member.summary: A VT_BOOL. If TRUE, then the paths for pre-localized and localized binaries have "\(LCID)" appended to them, where language code identifier (LCID) is the decimal locale ID for the localized language. The default is TRUE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.QueryParserManagerOption.LocalizerSupport
member.summary: A VT_UNKNOWN with an object supporting ISchemaLocalizerSupport. This object will be used instead of the default localizer support object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnail.RetrievalOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the current retrieval option is cache or extract, cache only, or from memory only. The default is cache or extract.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnail.FormatOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the current format option is thumbnail or icon, thumbnail only, or icon only. The default is thumbnail or icon.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnail.AllowBiggerSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if the user can manually stretch the returned image. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For example, if the caller passes in 80x80 a 96x96 thumbnail could be returned. This could be used as a performance optimization if the caller will need to stretch the image themselves anyway. Note that the Shell implementation performs a GDI stretch blit. If the caller wants a higher quality image stretch, they should pass this flag and do it themselves.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption
member.summary: Represents the different retrieval options for the thumbnail or icon, such as extracting the thumbnail or icon from a file, from the cache only, or from memory only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. If there is no thumbnail for the current ShellItem, the icon is retrieved. The thumbnail or icon is extracted if it is not currently cached.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.CacheOnly
member.summary: The CacheOnly behavior returns a cached thumbnail if it is available. Allows access to the disk, but only to retrieve a cached item. If no cached thumbnail is available, a cached per-instance icon is returned but a thumbnail or icon is not extracted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailRetrievalOption.MemoryOnly
member.summary: The MemoryOnly behavior returns the item only if it is in memory. The disk is not accessed even if the item is cached. Note that this only returns an already-cached icon and can fall back to a per-class icon if an item has a per-instance icon that has not been cached yet. Retrieving a thumbnail, even if it is cached, always requires the disk to be accessed, so this method should not be called from the user interface (UI) thread without passing ShellThumbnailCacheOptions.MemoryOnly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption
member.summary: Represents the format options for the thumbnails and icons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.Default
member.summary: The default behavior loads a thumbnail. An HBITMAP for the icon of the item is retrieved if there is no thumbnail for the current Shell Item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly
member.summary: The ThumbnailOnly behavior returns only the thumbnails, never the icon. Note that not all items have thumbnails so ShellThumbnailFormatOption.ThumbnailOnly can fail in these cases.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellThumbnailFormatOption.IconOnly
member.summary: The IconOnly behavior returns only the icon, never the thumbnail.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions
member.summary: Indicate flags that modify the property store object retrieved by methods that create a property store, such as IShellItem2::GetPropertyStore or IPropertyStoreFactory::GetPropertyStore.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Default
member.summary: Meaning to a calling process: Return a read-only property store that contains all properties. Slow items (offline files) are not opened. Combination with other flags: Can be overridden by other flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.HandlePropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Include only properties directly from the property handler, which opens the file on the disk, network, or device. Meaning to a file folder: Only include properties directly from the handler.
Meaning to other folders: When delegating to a file folder, pass this flag on to the file folder; do not do any multiplexing (MUX). When not delegating to a file folder, ignore this flag instead of returning a failure code.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_BESTEFFORT.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.ReadWrite
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Can write properties to the item. Note: The store may contain fewer properties than a read-only store.
Meaning to a file folder: ReadWrite.
Meaning to other folders: ReadWrite. Note: When using default MUX, return a single unmultiplexed store because the default MUX does not support ReadWrite.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY, GPS_BESTEFFORT, or GPS_DELAYCREATION. Implies GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.Temporary
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a writable store, with no initial properties, that exists for the lifetime of the Shell item instance; basically, a property bag attached to the item instance.
Meaning to a file folder: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Meaning to other folders: Not applicable. Handled by the Shell item.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with any other flag. Implies GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.FastPropertiesOnly
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Provides a store that does not involve reading from the disk or network. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Include the "innate" and "fallback" stores only. Do not load the handler.
Meaning to other folders: Include only properties that are available in memory or can be computed very quickly (no properties from disk, network, or peripheral IO devices). This is normally only data sources from the IDLIST. When delegating to other folders, pass this flag on to them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY, or GPS_DELAYCREATION.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.OpensLowItem
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Open a slow item (offline file) if necessary. Meaning to a file folder: Retrieve a file from offline storage, if necessary. Note: Without this flag, the handler is not created for offline files.
Meaning to other folders: Do not return any properties that are very slow.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_FASTPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.DelayCreation
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Delay memory-intensive operations, such as file access, until a property is requested that requires such access.
Meaning to a file folder: Do not create the handler until needed; for example, either GetCount/GetAt or GetValue, where the innate store does not satisfy the request. Note: GetValue might fail due to file access problems.
Meaning to other folders: If the folder has memory-intensive properties, such as delegating to a file folder or network access, it can optimize performance by supporting IDelayedPropertyStoreFactory and splitting up its properties into a fast and a slow store. It can then use delayed MUX to recombine them.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY or GPS_READWRITE

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.BestEffort
member.summary:
Meaning to a calling process: Succeed at getting the store, even if some properties are not returned. Note: Some values may be different, or missing, compared to a store without this flag.
Meaning to a file folder: Succeed and return a store, even if the handler or innate store has an error during creation. Only fail if substores fail.
Meaning to other folders: Succeed on getting the store, even if some properties are not returned.
Combination with other flags: Cannot be combined with GPS_TEMPORARY, GPS_READWRITE, or GPS_HANDLERPROPERTIESONLY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.GetPropertyStoreOptions.MaskValid
member.summary: Mask for valid GETPROPERTYSTOREFLAGS values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanCopy
member.summary: The specified items can be copied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanMove
member.summary: The specified items can be moved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanLink
member.summary: Shortcuts can be created for the specified items. This flag has the same value as DROPEFFECT. The normal use of this flag is to add a Create Shortcut item to the shortcut menu that is displayed during drag-and-drop operations. However, SFGAO_CANLINK also adds a Create Shortcut item to the Microsoft Windows Explorer's File menu and to normal shortcut menus. If this item is selected, your application's IContextMenu::InvokeCommand is invoked with the lpVerb member of the CMINVOKECOMMANDINFO structure set to "link." Your application is responsible for creating the link.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Storage
member.summary: The specified items can be bound to an IStorage interface through IShellFolder::BindToObject.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanRename

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.System
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The specified items are system items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Encrypted

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.IsSlow
member.summary: Indicates that accessing the object = through IStream or other storage interfaces, is a slow operation. Applications should avoid accessing items flagged with SFGAO_ISSLOW.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Ghosted
member.summary: The specified items are ghosted icons.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Link
member.summary: The specified items are shortcuts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Share
member.summary: The specified folder objects are shared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.ReadOnly
member.summary: The specified items are read-only. In the case of folders, this means that new items cannot be created in those folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Hidden
member.summary: The item is hidden and should not be displayed unless the Show hidden files and folders option is enabled in Folder Settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.DisplayAttributeMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for the display attributes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.FileSystemAncestor
member.summary: The specified folders contain one or more file system folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Folder
member.summary: The specified items are folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.FileSystem
member.summary: The specified folders or file objects are part of the file system that is, they are files, directories, or root directories).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.HasSubFolder
member.summary: The specified folders have subfolders = and are, therefore, expandable in the left pane of Windows Explorer).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.ContentsMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for the contents attributes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Validate
member.summary: When specified as input, SFGAO_VALIDATE instructs the folder to validate that the items pointed to by the contents of apidl exist. If one or more of those items do not exist, IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf returns a failure code. When used with the file system folder, SFGAO_VALIDATE instructs the folder to discard cached properties retrieved by clients of IShellFolder2::GetDetailsEx that may have accumulated for the specified items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Removable
member.summary: The specified items are on removable media or are themselves removable devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Compressed
member.summary: The specified items are compressed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Browsable
member.summary: The specified items can be browsed in place.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Nonenumerated
member.summary: The items are nonenumerated items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.NewContent
member.summary: The objects contain new content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.CanMoniker
member.summary: It is possible to create monikers for the specified file objects or folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.HasStorage
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.Stream
member.summary: Indicates that the item has a stream associated with it that can be accessed by a call to IShellFolder::BindToObject with IID_IStream in the riid parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.StorageAncestor
member.summary: Children of this item are accessible through IStream or IStorage. Those children are flagged with SFGAO_STORAGE or SFGAO_STREAM.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.StorageCapabilityMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for the storage capability attributes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellNativeMethods.ShellFileGetAttributesOptions.PkeyMask
member.summary: Mask used by PKEY_SFGAOFlags to remove certain values that are considered to cause slow calculations or lack context. Equal to SFGAO_VALIDATE | SFGAO_ISSLOW | SFGAO_HASSUBFOLDER.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes
member.summary:
The STGM constants are flags that indicate conditions for creating and deleting the object and access modes for the object.
You can combine these flags, but you can only choose one flag from each group of related flags. Typically one flag from each of the access and sharing groups must be specified for all functions and methods which use these constants.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Direct
member.summary: Indicates that, in direct mode, each change to a storage or stream element is written as it occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Transacted
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, changes are buffered and written only if an explicit commit operation is called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Simple
member.summary: Provides a faster implementation of a compound file in a limited, but frequently used, case.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Read
member.summary: Indicates that the object is read-only, meaning that modifications cannot be made.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Write
member.summary: Enables you to save changes to the object, but does not permit access to its data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables access and modification of object data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyNone
member.summary: Specifies that subsequent openings of the object are not denied read or write access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyRead
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in Read mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.ShareDenyWrite
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object for Write or ReadWrite access.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.ShareExclusive
member.summary: Prevents others from subsequently opening the object in any mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Priority
member.summary: Opens the storage object with exclusive access to the most recently committed version.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.DeleteOnRelease
member.summary: Indicates that the underlying file is to be automatically destroyed when the root storage object is released. This feature is most useful for creating temporary files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.NoScratch
member.summary: Indicates that, in transacted mode, a temporary scratch file is usually used to save modifications until the Commit method is called. Specifying NoScratch permits the unused portion of the original file to be used as work space instead of creating a new file for that purpose.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Create
member.summary: Indicates that an existing storage object or stream should be removed before the new object replaces it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.Convert
member.summary: Creates the new object while preserving existing data in a stream named "Contents".

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.FailIfThere
member.summary: Causes the create operation to fail if an existing object with the specified name exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.NoSnapshot
member.summary: This flag is used when opening a storage object with Transacted and without ShareExclusive or ShareDenyWrite. In this case, specifying NoSnapshot prevents the system-provided implementation from creating a snapshot copy of the file. Instead, changes to the file are written to the end of the file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.AccessModes.DirectSingleWriterMultipleReader
member.summary: Supports direct mode for single-writer, multireader file operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Border
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Caption
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Child
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.ChildWindow
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipChildren
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.ClipSiblings
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Disabled
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.DialogFrame
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Group
member.summary:
The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.HorizontalScroll
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Iconic
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Maximize
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.MaximizeBox
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specifie

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Minimize
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.MinimizeBox
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Overlapped
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Popup
member.summary: The windows is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.SizeBox
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.SystemMenu
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Tabstop
member.summary:
The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.
You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.ThickFrame
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Tiled
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.Visible
member.summary:
The window is initially visible.
This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.VerticalScroll
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.TiledWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.PopupWindowMask
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.WindowStyles.OverlappedWindowMask
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.remarks: Functions that are benign but not performance critical should be located in the NativeMethods class.

member.summary: Retrieve the small version of the icon, as specified by SM_CXSMICON and SM_CYSMICON system metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.ShellSize
member.summary: Retrieve the shell-sized icons (instead of the size specified by the system metrics).

member.summary: Specified that the hIcon member of the SHSTOCKICONINFO structure receives a handle to the specified icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIconsNativeMethods.StockIconOptions.Selected

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory
member.summary: Specifies the categories for known folders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory.None
member.summary: The folder category is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory.Virtual
member.summary: The folder is a virtual folder. Virtual folders are not part of the file system. For example, Control Panel and Printers are virtual folders. A number of properties such as folder path and redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory.Fixed
member.summary: The folder is fixed. Fixed file system folders are not managed by the Shell and are usually given a permanent path when the system is installed. For example, the Windows and Program Files folders are fixed folders. A number of properties such as redirection do not apply to this category.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory.Common
member.summary: The folder is a common folder. Common folders are used for sharing data and settings accessible by all users of a system. For example, all users share a common Documents folder as well as their per-user Documents folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderCategory.PerUser
member.summary: Each user has their own copy of the folder. Per-user folders are those stored under each user's profile and accessible only by that user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderProperties
member.summary: Structure used internally to store property values for a known folder. This structure holds the information returned in the FOLDER_DEFINITION structure, and resources referenced by fields in NativeFolderDefinition, such as icon and tool tip.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes
member.summary: The FolderTypes values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.NotSpecified
member.summary: No particular content type has been detected or specified. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Music
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.MusicIcons
member.summary: A list of music files displayed in Icons view. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelCategory
member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.ControlPanelClassic
member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.SoftwareExplorer
member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Contacts
member.summary: An e-mail-related folder that contains contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Library
member.summary: A default library view without a more specific template. This value is not supported in Windows 7 and later systems.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.UserFiles
member.summary: The folder is the FOLDERID_UsersFiles folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.GenericLibrary
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder is a library, but of no specified type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Videos
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains video files. These can be of mixed format.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.UsersLibraries
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view shown when the user clicks the Windows Explorer button on the taskbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.OtherUsers
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The homegroup view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Communications
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A folder that contains communication-related files such as e-mails, calendar information, and contact information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.RecordedTV
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.SavedGames
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.OpenSearch
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The folder contains federated search OpenSearch results.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.SearchConnector
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Before you search.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.FolderTypes.Searches
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.summary: Gets the path for this known folder.

member.summary: Gets the category designation for this known folder.

member.summary: Gets this known folder's canonical name.

member.summary: Gets this known folder's relative path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.ParsingName
member.summary: Gets this known folder's parsing name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets this known folder's tool tip text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.TooltipResourceId
member.summary: Gets the resource identifier for this known folder's tool tip text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.LocalizedName
member.summary: Gets this known folder's localized name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.LocalizedNameResourceId
member.summary: Gets the resource identifier for this known folder's localized name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.Security
member.summary: Gets this known folder's security attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.FileAttributes
member.summary: Gets this known folder's file attributes, such as "read-only".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.DefinitionOptions
member.summary: Gets an value that describes this known folder's behaviors.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.FolderTypeId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this known folder's type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.FolderType
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this known folder's type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.FolderId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this known folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.PathExists
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this known folder's path exists on the computer.
member.remarks: If this property value is false, the folder might be a virtual folder ( property will be for virtual folders)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolder.Redirection
member.summary: Gets a value that states whether this known folder can have its path set to a new value, including any restrictions on the redirection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper
member.summary: Creates the helper class for known folders.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPIDL(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Returns the native known folder (IKnownFolderNative) given a PID list

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given Known Folder ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromKnownFolderIdInternal(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given a globally unique identifier.
member.param: A GUID for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name. Returns null if Known Folder is not found or could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.GetKnownFolder(Microsoft.Windows.Shell.IKnownFolderNative)
member.summary: Given a native KnownFolder (IKnownFolderNative), create the right type of IKnownFolder object (FileSystemKnownFolder or NonFileSystemKnownFolder)
member.param: Native Known Folder

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromCanonicalName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the known folder given its canonical name.
member.param: A non-localized canonical name for the known folder, such as MyComputer.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given canonical name is invalid or if the KnownFolder could not be created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell path, such as C:\users\public\documents or ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The path for the requested known folder; either a physical path or a virtual path.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.KnownFolderHelper.FromParsingName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a known folder given its shell namespace parsing name, such as ::{645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E} for the Recycle Bin.
member.param: The parsing name (or path) for the requested known folder.
member.returns: A known folder representing the specified name.
member.exception: Thrown if the given parsing name is invalid.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher.Start
member.summary:
Start the watcher and begin receiving change notifications.
If the watcher is running, has no effect. Registration for notifications should be done before this is called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stop the watcher and prevent further notifications from being received. If the watcher is not running, this has no effect.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes
member.summary: Describes the event that has occurred. Typically, only one event is specified at a time. If more than one event is specified, the values contained in the dwItem1 and dwItem2 parameters must be the same, respectively, for all specified events. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemRename
member.summary: The name of a nonfolder item has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the item. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemCreate
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ItemDelete
member.summary: A nonfolder item has been deleted. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that was deleted. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryCreate
member.summary: A folder has been created. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was created. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryDelete
member.summary: A folder has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.MediaInsert
member.summary: Storage media has been inserted into a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that contains the new media. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.MediaRemove
member.summary: Storage media has been removed from a drive. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive from which the media was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DriveRemove
member.summary: A drive has been removed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was removed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DriveAdd
member.summary: A drive has been added. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive that was added. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.NetShare
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.NetUnshare
member.summary: A folder on the local computer is no longer being shared via the network. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that is no longer being shared. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AttributesChange
member.summary: The attributes of an item or folder have changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item or folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryContentsUpdate
member.summary: The contents of an existing folder have changed, but the folder still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the folder that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a folder has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_MKDIR, SHCNE_RMDIR, or SHCNE_RENAMEFOLDER, respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.Update
member.summary: An existing item (a folder or a nonfolder) has changed, but the item still exists and has not been renamed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the item that has changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL. If a nonfolder item has been created, deleted, or renamed, use SHCNE_CREATE, SHCNE_DELETE, or SHCNE_RENAMEITEM, respectively, instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.ServerDisconnect
member.summary: The computer has disconnected from a server. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the server from which the computer was disconnected. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

members.member: An image in the system image list has changed. SHCNF_DWORD must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 is not used and should be NULL. dwItem2 contains the index in the system image list that has changed. //verify this is not opposite?

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DirectoryRename
member.summary: The name of a folder has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the previous PIDL or name of the folder. dwItem2 contains the new PIDL or name of the folder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.FreeSpace
member.summary: The amount of free space on a drive has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST or SHCNF_PATH must be specified in uFlags. dwItem1 contains the root of the drive on which the free space changed. dwItem2 is not used and should be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AssociationChange
member.summary: A file type association has changed. SHCNF_IDLIST must be specified in the uFlags parameter. dwItem1 and dwItem2 are not used and must be NULL.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.DiskEventsMask
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the disk event identifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.GlobalEventsMask
member.summary: Specifies a combination of all of the global event identifiers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.AllEventsMask
member.summary: All events have occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.ShellObjectChangeTypes.FromInterrupt
member.summary: The specified event occurred as a result of a system interrupt. As this value modifies other event values, it cannot be used alone.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIcons
member.summary: Collection of all the standard system stock icons

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIcons.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a stock icon collection using the default options for size, link overlay and selection state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIcons.#ctor(Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIconSize,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overloaded constructor that takes in size and Boolean values for link overlay and selected icon state. The settings are applied to all the stock icons in the collection.
member.param: StockIcon size for all the icons in the collection.
Link Overlay state for all the icons in the collection.
Selection state for all the icons in the collection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIcons.DefaultSize

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIcons.GetStockIcon(Microsoft.Windows.Shell.StockIconIdentifier)
member.summary: Returns the existing stock icon from the internal cache, or creates a new one based on the current settings if it's not in the cache.
member.param: Unique identifier for the requested stock icon
member.returns: Stock Icon based on the identifier given (either from the cache or created new)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1
member.summary: Defines an interface with which the low-level data contained inside MappingPropertyBag and MappingDataRange objects can be formatted into .NET objects.
member.typeparam: The type of the objects into which the low-level data should be converted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1.Format(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange)
member.summary: Formats a single MappingDataRange into the type specified by T.
member.param: The MappingDataRange object to format.
member.returns: The formatted object constructed with the data contained inside the MappingDataRange.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter`1.FormatAll(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag)
member.summary: Formats all MappingDataRanges contained inside the MappingPropertyBag.
member.param: The MappingPropertyBag to format.
member.returns: An array of T objects which represent the data contained inside each MappingDataRange of the provided MappingPropertyBag object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException
member.summary: This exception is thrown by the managed wrappers of ELS when the underlying unmanaged implementation returns an HResult which is not S_OK (0). This exception is also thrown when the managed wrapper detects an exceptional condition which causes it to fail. Please note that other .NET exceptions are also possible to be thrown from the ELS managed wrappers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the last Win32 error that occurred.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified context and the serialization information.
member.param: The SerializationInfo associated with this exception.
A StreamingContext that represents the context of this exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified detailed description.
member.param: A detailed description of the error.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinguisticException class with the specified detailed description and the specified exception.
member.param: A detailed description of the error.
A reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.LinguisticException.ResultState
member.summary: Gets the MappingResultState describing the error condition for this exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange
member.summary: Contains text recognition results for a recognized text subrange. An array of structures of this type is retrieved by an ELS service in a MappingPropertyBag structure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.StartIndex
member.summary: Index of the beginning of the subrange in the text, where 0 indicates the first character of the string passed to MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText, instead of an offset to the index passed to the function in the index parameter. The value should be less than the entire length of the text.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.EndIndex
member.summary: Index of the end of the subrange in the text, where 0 indicates the first character at of the string passed to MappingService.RecognizeText or MappingService.BeginRecognizeText, instead of an offset to the index passed to the function in the index parameter. The value should be less than the entire length of the text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.GetData
member.summary: The data retrieved as service output associated with the subrange. This data must be of the format indicated by the content type supplied in the ContentType property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ContentType
member.summary:
A string specifying the MIME content type of the data returned by GetData(). Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css".
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ActionIds
member.summary:
Available action IDs for this data range. Usable for calling MappingService.DoAction or MappingService.BeginDoAction.
In Windows 7, the ELS services do not expose any actions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.ActionDisplayNames
member.summary:
Available action display names for this data range. These strings can be localized.
In Windows 7, the ELS services do not expose any actions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingDataRange.FormatData``1(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.IMappingFormatter{``0})
member.summary: Formats the low-level data contained in this MappingDataRange using an implementation of the IMappingFormatter interface.
member.typeparam: The type with which IMappingFormatter is parameterized.
member.param: The formatter to be used in the formatting.
member.returns: A formatted version of this MappingDataRange.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions
member.summary: Contains options used to enumerate ELS services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor. Initializes an empty instance of MappingEnumOptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.Category
member.summary: Optional. A service category, for example, "Transliteration". The application must set this member to null if the service category is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An input language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the input language that services should accept. The application can set this member to null if the supported input language is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An output language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the output language that services use to retrieve results. The application can set this member to null if the output language is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that can be accepted by services. The application set this member to null if the input script is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name used by services. The application can set this member to null if the output script is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.InputContentType
member.summary:
Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format that the services should be able to interpret when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css". The application can set this member to null if the input content type is not a search criterion.
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.OutputContentType
member.summary: Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format in which the services retrieve data. The application can set this member to null if the output content type is not a search criterion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions.Guid
member.summary: Optional. A globally unique identifier (guid) structure for a specific service. The application must avoid setting this member at all if the guid is not a search criterion.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions
member.summary: Contains options for text recognition. The values stored in this structure affect the behavior and results of MappingRecognizeText.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor. Initializes an empty instance of MappingOptions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An input language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the input language that the service should be able to accept. The application can set this member to null to indicate that the service is free to interpret the input as any input language it supports.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputLanguage
member.summary: Optional. An output language string, following the IETF naming convention, that identifies the output language that the service should be able to use to produce results. The application can set this member to null if the service should decide the output language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that should be accepted by the service. The application can set this member to null to let the service decide how handle the input.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputScript
member.summary: Optional. A standard Unicode script name that the service should use to retrieve results. The application can set this member to null to let the service decide the output script.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.InputContentType
member.summary:
Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format that the service should be able to interpret when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html", and "text/css". The application can set this member to null to indicate the "text/plain" content type.
In Windows 7, the ELS services support only the content type "text/plain". A content type specification can be found at the IANA website: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/text/

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.OutputContentType
member.summary: Optional. A string, following the format of the MIME content types, that identifies the format in which the service should retrieve data. The application can set this member to NULL to let the service decide the output content type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions.ServiceFlag
member.summary:
Optional. Private flag that a service provider defines to affect service behavior. Services can interpret this flag as they require.
For Windows 7, none of the available ELS services support flags.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService
member.summary: Represents an ELS service. A detailed overview of the Extended Linguistic Services platform is available at: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd317839(VS.85).aspx

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary:
Constructs a new MappingService object by instanciating an ELS service by its guid. For Windows 7, the only supported GUIDs are provided as readonly members of the MappingAvailableServices class.
If the service with the specified guid doesn't exist, a LinguisticException is thrown.
member.param: The guid of the service to instantiate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.GetServices(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingEnumOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available ELS platform-supported services, along with associated information, according to application-specified criteria.
member.param: Optional. A MappingEnumOptions object containing criteria to use during enumeration of services. The application specifies null for this parameter to retrieve all installed services.
member.returns: An array of MappingService objects matching the criteria supplied in the options parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.RecognizeText(System.String,Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
member.returns: A MappingPropertyBag object in which the service has stored its results. The structure is filled with information produced by the service during text recognition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.RecognizeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.
Length, in characters, of the text specified in text.
Index inside the specified text to be used by the service. This value should be between 0 and length-1. If the application wants to process the entire text, it should set this parameter to 0.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
member.returns: A MappingPropertyBag object in which the service has stored its results. The structure is filled with information produced by the service during text recognition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginRecognizeText(System.String,Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written. The execution will be handled in a thread from the managed thread pool, and the asynchronous wait handle of the returned MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object will be notified when the operation completes. The results of the call will be stored inside the MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the recognize operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after text recognition is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginRecognizeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingOptions,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Calls an ELS service to recognize text. For example, the Microsoft Language Detection service will attempt to recognize the language in which the input text is written. The execution will be handled in a thread from the managed thread pool, and the asynchronous wait handle of the returned MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object will be notified when the operation completes. The results of the call will be stored inside the MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object.
member.param: The text to recognize. The text must be UTF-16, but some services have additional requirements for the input format. This parameter cannot be set to null.
Length, in characters, of the text specified in text.
Index inside the specified text to be used by the service. This value should be between 0 and length-1. If the application wants to process the entire text, it should set this parameter to 0.

Optional. A MappingOptions object containing options that affect the result and behavior of text recognition. The application does not have to specify values for all object members. This parameter can be set to null to use the default mapping options.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the recognize operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after text recognition is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.EndRecognizeText(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingRecognizeAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the asynchronous operation to complete.
member.param: The MappingRecognizeAsyncResult object associated with the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.DoAction(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Causes an ELS service to perform an action after text recognition has occurred. For example, a phone dialer service first must recognize phone numbers and then can perform the "action" of dialing a number.
member.param: A MappingPropertyBag object containing the results of a previous call to MappingService.MappingRecognizeText. This parameter cannot be set to null.
A starting index inside the text recognition results for a recognized text range. This value should be between 0 and the range count.
The identifier of the action to perform. This parameter cannot be set to null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.BeginDoAction(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingPropertyBag,System.Int32,System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes an ELS service to perform an action after text recognition has occurred. For example, a phone dialer service first must recognize phone numbers and then can perform the "action" of dialing a number.
member.param: A MappingPropertyBag object containing the results of a previous call to MappingService.MappingRecognizeText. This parameter cannot be set to null.
A starting index inside the text recognition results for a recognized text range. This value should be between 0 and the range count.
The identifier of the action to perform. This parameter cannot be set to null.
An application callback delegate to receive callbacks with the results from the action operation. Cannot be set to null.

Optional. Private application object passed to the callback function by a service after the action operation is complete. The application must set this parameter to null to indicate no private application data.
member.returns: A MappingActionAsyncResult object describing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.EndDoAction(Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingActionAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits for the asynchronous operation to complete.
member.param: The MappingActionAsyncResult object associated with the operation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputContentTypes
member.summary: Optional. A collection of input content types, following the format of the MIME content types, that identify the format that the service interprets when the application passes data. Examples of content types are "text/plain", "text/html" and "text/css".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputContentTypes
member.summary: Optional. A collection of output content types, following the format of the MIME content types, that identify the format in which the service retrieves data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputLanguages
member.summary: A collection of the input languages, following the IETF naming convention, that the service accepts. This member is set to null if the service can work with any input language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputLanguages
member.summary: A collection of output languages, following the IETF naming convention, in which the service can retrieve results. This member is set to null if the service can retrieve results in any language, or if the service ignores the output language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.InputScripts
member.summary: A collection of input scripts, with Unicode standard script names, that are supported by the service. This member is set to null if the service can work with any scripts, or if the service ignores the input scripts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.OutputScripts
member.summary: A collection of output scripts supported by the service. This member is set to null if the service can work with any scripts, or the service ignores the output scripts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Guid
member.summary: Globally unique identifier (guid) for the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Category
member.summary: The service category for the service, for example, "Transliteration".

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.Description
member.summary: The service description. This text can be localized.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.IsOneToOneLanguageMapping
member.summary: Flag indicating the language mapping between input language and output language that is supported by the service. Possible values are shown in the following table. 0 - The input and output languages are not paired and the service can receive data in any of the input languages and render data in any of the output languages. 1 - The arrays of the input and output languages for the service are paired. In other words, given a particular input language, the service retrieves results in the paired language defined in the output language array. Use of the language pairing can be useful, for example, in bilingual dictionary scenarios.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.IsPlatformSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether this feature is supported on the current platform.

member.summary: Determines if the application is running on Windows 7

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.ExtendedLinguisticServices.MappingService.ThrowIfNotWin7
member.summary: Throws PlatformNotSupportedException if the application is not running on Windows 7
