member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceKeyCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of PROPERTYKEY values. This interface can be retrieved from a method or, if a new object is required, call CoCreate with CLSID_PortableDeviceKeyCollection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues
member.summary: The nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface holds a collection of PROPERTYKEY/PropVariant pairs. Values in the collection do not need to be all the same VARTYPE. Values are stored as key-value pairs; each key must be unique in the collection. Clients can search for items by PROPERTYKEY or zero-based index. Data values are stored as PropVariant structures. You can add or retrieve values of any type by using the generic methods SetValue and GetValue, or you add items by using the method specific to the type of data added.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of indexed nativeIPortableDeviceValues interfaces. This interface can be retrieved from a method, or if a new object is required, call CoCreate with CLSID_PortableDeviceValuesCollection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.GetCount(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves the number of items in the collection.
member.param: Pointer to a DWORD that contains the number of nativeIPortableDeviceValues interfaces in the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.GetAt(System.UInt32,Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues@)
member.summary: Retrieves an item from the collection by a zero-based index.
member.param: DWORD that specifies a zero-based index in the collection.
Address of a variable that receives a pointer to an nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface from the collection. The caller is responsible for calling Release on this interface when done with it

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.Add(Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValues)
member.summary: Adds an item to the collection.
member.param: Pointer to an nativeIPortableDeviceValues interface to add to the collection. The interface is not actually copied, but AddRef is called on it

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.Clear
member.summary: Releases all items from the collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDeviceValuesCollection.RemoveAt(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes an item from the collection by a zero-based index.
member.param: DWORD that specifies a zero-based index in the collection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Sensors.IPortableDevicePropVariantCollection
member.summary: Holds a collection of PropVariant values of the same VARTYPE. The VARTYPE of the first item that is added to the collection determines the VARTYPE of the collection. An attempt to add an item of a different VARTYPE may fail if the PropVariant value cannot be changed to the collection?s current VARTYPE. To change the VARTYPE of the collection manually, call ChangeType

member.summary: Below this size thumbnail images will not be generated - file icons will be used instead.

member.summary: A resource reference string pointing to the icon to be used as an overlay on the bottom right of the thumbnail. ex. ISVComponent.dll@,-155 ex. C:\Windows\System32\SampleIcon.ico If an empty string is provided, no overlay will be used. If the property is set to null, the default icon for the associated icon will be used as an overlay.

member.summary:
Specifies the for the thumbnail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Controls.IExplorerBrowser.Initialize(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Windows.Shell.NativeRect@,Microsoft.Windows.Controls.FolderSettings)
member.summary: Prepares the browser to be navigated.
member.param: A handle to the owner window or control.

A pointer to a RECT containing the coordinates of the bounding rectangle the browser will occupy. The coordinates are relative to hwndParent. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetRect should subsequently be called.

A pointer to a FOLDERSETTINGS structure that determines how the folder will be displayed in the view. If this parameter is NULL, then method IExplorerBrowser::SetFolderSettings should be called, otherwise, the default view settings for the folder are used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.JumpList.MaxSlotsInList
member.summary: Gets the recommended number of items to add to the jump list.
member.remarks: This number doesn’t imply or suggest how many items will appear on the jump list. This number should only be used for reference purposes since the actual number of slots in the jump list can change after the last refresh due to items being pinned or removed and resolution changes. The jump list can increase in size accordingly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.param: The image to use.
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.param: The image to use.
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.SetImage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Override the thumbnail and peek bitmap. By providing this bitmap manually, Thumbnail Window manager will provide the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) this bitmap instead of rendering one automatically. Use this property to update the bitmap whenever the control is updated and the user needs to be shown a new thumbnail on the taskbar preview (or aero peek).
member.param:
A bitmap handle for the image to use.
When the TabbedThumbnail is finalized, this class will delete the provided hBitmap.
member.remarks: If the bitmap doesn't have the right dimensions, the DWM may scale it or not render certain areas as appropriate - it is the user's responsibility to render a bitmap with the proper dimensions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnail.DisplayFrameAroundBitmap
member.summary: Specifies whether a standard window frame will be displayed around the bitmap. If the bitmap represents a top-level window, you would probably set this flag to true. If the bitmap represents a child window (or a frameless window), you would probably set this flag to false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.InvalidateThumbnails
member.summary: Invalidates all the tabbed thumbnails. This will force the Desktop Window Manager to not use the cached thumbnail or preview or aero peek and request a new one next time.
member.remarks: This method should not be called frequently. Doing so can lead to poor performance as new bitmaps are created and retrieved.

member.summary: Clear a clip that is already in place and return to the default display of the thumbnail.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TabbedThumbnailManager.SetThumbnailClip(System.IntPtr,System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Rectangle})
member.summary: Selects a portion of a window's client area to display as that window's thumbnail in the taskbar.
member.param: The handle to a window represented in the taskbar. This has to be a top-level window.

Rectangle structure that specifies a selection within the window's client area, relative to the upper-left corner of that client area.
If this parameter is null, the clipping area will be cleared and the default display of the thumbnail will be used instead.

member.param: Preview for the window whose order is being changed. This value is required, must already be added via AddThumbnailPreview method, and cannot be null.

The preview of the tab window whose thumbnail that previewToChange is inserted to the left of. This preview must already be added via AddThumbnailPreview. If this value is null, the previewToChange tab is added to the end of the list.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.TaskbarManager.SetApplicationIdForSpecificWindow(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the application user model id for an individual window
member.param: The app id to set
Window handle for the window that needs a specific application id
member.remarks: AppId specifies a unique Application User Model ID (AppID) for the application or individual top-level window whose taskbar button will hold the custom JumpList built through the methods class. By setting an appId for a specific window, the window will not be grouped with it's parent window/application. Instead it will have it's own taskbar button.

member.remarks: AppId specifies a unique Application User Model ID (AppID) for the application or individual top-level window whose taskbar button will hold the custom JumpList built through the methods class. By setting an appId for a specific window, the window will not be grouped with it's parent window/application. Instead it will have it's own taskbar button.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarButton.IsInteractive
member.summary: Gets or sets the property that describes whether the button is interactive with the user. Default is true.
member.remarks: Non-interactive buttons don't display any hover behavior nor do they raise click events. They are intended to be used as status icons. This is mostly similar to being not Enabled, but the image is not desaturated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarManager
member.summary: Thumbnail toolbar manager class for adding a thumbnail toolbar with a specified set of buttons to the thumbnail image of a window in a taskbar button flyout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarManager.AddButtons(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarButton[])
member.summary: Adds thumbnail toolbar for the specified window.
member.param: Window handle for which the thumbnail toolbar buttons need to be added
Thumbnail buttons for the window's thumbnail toolbar
member.exception: If the number of buttons exceed the maximum allowed capacity (7).
If the Window Handle passed in invalid
member.remarks: After a toolbar has been added to a thumbnail, buttons can be altered only through various properties on the . While individual buttons cannot be added or removed, they can be shown and hidden through as needed. The toolbar itself cannot be removed without re-creating the window itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarManager.AddButtons(System.Windows.UIElement,Microsoft.Windows.Taskbar.ThumbnailToolBarButton[])
member.summary: Adds thumbnail toolbar for the specified WPF Control.
member.param: WPF Control for which the thumbnail toolbar buttons need to be added
Thumbnail buttons for the window's thumbnail toolbar
member.exception: If the number of buttons exceed the maximum allowed capacity (7).
If the control passed in null
member.remarks: After a toolbar has been added to a thumbnail, buttons can be altered only through various properties on the ThumbnailToolBarButton. While individual buttons cannot be added or removed, they can be shown and hidden through ThumbnailToolBarButton.Visible as needed. The toolbar itself cannot be removed without re-creating the window itself.
